post.description: Retrieve the archived sequence for a set of identifiers.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: { "id" : array }

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

get.description: Uses the given identifier to return the archived sequence.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl Stable ID

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

get.description: Retrieves a gene tree for a gene tree stable identifier

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl Stable ID

parameters.name: aligned
parameters.description: Return the aligned string if true. Otherwise, return the original sequence (no insertions)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: cigar_line
parameters.description: Return the aligned sequence encoded in CIGAR format

parameters.name: clusterset_id
parameters.description: Name of the gene-tree resource being queried. Common values are "default" for the standard multi-clade trees (which exclude all non-reference strains) and "murinae" for the trees spanning all mouse strains. By default, the most inclusive analysis will be selected

parameters.name: compara
parameters.description: Name of the compara database to use. Multiple comparas can exist on a server if you are accessing Ensembl Genomes data

parameters.name: nh_format
parameters.description: The format of a NH (New Hampshire) request.

parameters.name: prune_species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: prune_taxon
parameters.description: Prune the tree by taxon

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The type of sequence to bring back. Setting it to none results in no sequence being returned

get.description: Retrieves the gene tree that contains the gene / transcript / translation stable identifier

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl Stable ID

parameters.name: aligned
parameters.description: Return the aligned string if true. Otherwise, return the original sequence (no insertions)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.description: Name of the gene-tree resource being queried. Common values are "default" for the standard multi-clade trees (which exclude all non-reference strains) and "murinae" for the trees spanning all mouse strains. By default, the most inclusive analysis will be selected

parameters.name: compara
parameters.description: Name of the compara database to use. Multiple comparas can exist on a server if you are accessing Ensembl Genomes data

parameters.name: db_type
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: nh_format
parameters.description: The format of a NH (New Hampshire) request.

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter by feature type

parameters.name: prune_taxon
parameters.description: Prune the tree by taxon

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The type of sequence to bring back. Setting it to none results in no sequence being returned

parameters.name: species

parameters.name: compara

get.description: Retrieves genomic alignments as separate blocks based on a region and species

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Query region. A maximum of 10Mb is allowed to be requested at any one time

parameters.name: aligned
parameters.description: Return the aligned string if true. Otherwise, return the original sequence (no insertions)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: compact
parameters.description: Applicable to EPO_LOW_COVERAGE alignments. If true, concatenate the low coverage species sequences together to create a single sequence. Otherwise, separates out all sequences.

parameters.name: compara
parameters.description: Name of the compara database to use. Multiple comparas can exist on a server if you are accessing Ensembl Genomes data

parameters.name: display_species_set
parameters.description: Subset of species in the alignment to be displayed (multiple values). All the species in the alignment will be displayed if this is not set. Any valid alias may be used..

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The alignment method

parameters.name: species_set
parameters.description: The set of species used to define the pairwise alignment (multiple values). Should not be used with the species_set_group parameter. Use /info/compara/species_sets/:method with one of the methods listed above to obtain a valid list of species sets. Any valid alias may be used.

parameters.name: species_set_group
parameters.description: The species set group name of the multiple alignment. Should not be used with the species_set parameter. Use /info/compara/species_sets/:method with one of the methods listed above to obtain a valid list of group names.

get.description: Retrieves genomic alignments as separate blocks based on a region and species

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl Stable ID

parameters.name: aligned
parameters.description: Return the aligned string if true. Otherwise, return the original sequence (no insertions)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: cigar_line
parameters.description: Return the aligned sequence encoded in CIGAR format

parameters.name: compara
parameters.description: Name of the compara database to use. Multiple comparas can exist on a server if you are accessing Ensembl Genomes data

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Layout of the response

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The type of sequence to bring back. Setting it to none results in no sequence being returned

parameters.name: target_species
parameters.description: Filter by species. Supports all species aliases

parameters.name: target_taxon
parameters.description: Filter by taxons

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of homology to return from this call. Projections are orthology calls defined between alternative assemblies and the genes shared between them. Useful if you need only one type of homology back from the service

get.description: Perform lookups of Ensembl Identifiers and retrieve their external references in other databases

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl Stable ID

parameters.name: all_levels
parameters.description: Set to find all genetic features linked to the stable ID, and fetch all external references for them. Specifying this on a gene will also return values from its transcripts and translations

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.description: Filter by external database

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter by feature type

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

get.description: Looks up an external symbol and returns all Ensembl objects linked to it. This can be a display name for a gene/transcript/translation, a synonym or an externally linked reference. If a gene's transcript is linked to the supplied symbol the service will return both gene and transcript (it supports transient links).

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Symbol or display name of a gene

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: external_db
parameters.description: Filter by external database

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter by feature type

parameters.name: bands
parameters.description: If set to 1, include karyotype band information. Only display if band information is available.

parameters.description: If set to 1, include karyotype band information. Only display if band information is available.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: The class of the method to query for. Regular expression patterns are supported.

parameters.name: compara

get.description: List all collections of species analysed with the specified compara method.

parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.description: Restrict external DB searches to a single source or pattern. SQL-LIKE patterns are supported.

get.description: Computes and returns LD values between the given variant and all other variants in a window centered around the given variant. The window size is set to 500 kb.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Variant id

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: d_prime
parameters.description: Measure of LD. If D' is provided only return pairs of variants whose D' value is equal to or greater than the value provided.

parameters.name: population_name
parameters.description: Only compute LD for this population. Use GET /info/variation/populations/:species?filter=LD to retrieve a list of all populations with LD data.

parameters.name: r2
parameters.description: Measure of LD. If r-squared is provided only return pairs of variants whose r-squared value is equal to or greater than the value provided.

parameters.name: window_size
parameters.description: Window size in kb. The maximum allowed value for the window size is 500 kb. LD is computed for the given variant and all variants that are located within the specified window.

get.description: Computes and returns LD values between the given variants.

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: Variant id

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Variant id

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: d_prime
parameters.description: Measure of LD. If D' is provided only return pairs of variants whose D' value is equal to or greater than the value provided.

parameters.name: population_name
parameters.description: Only compute LD for this population. Use GET /info/variation/populations/:species?filter=LD to retrieve a list of all populations with LD data.

parameters.name: r2
parameters.description: Measure of LD. If r-squared is provided only return pairs of variants whose r-squared value is equal to or greater than the value provided.

get.description: Computes and returns LD values between all pairs of variants in the defined region.

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Query region. A maximum of 10Mb is allowed to be requested at any one time

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: d_prime
parameters.description: Measure of LD. If D' is provided only return pairs of variants whose D' value is equal to or greater than the value provided.

parameters.name: population_name
parameters.description: Only compute LD for this population. Use GET /info/variation/populations/:species?filter=LD to retrieve a list of all populations with LD data.

parameters.name: r2
parameters.description: Measure of LD. If r-squared is provided only return pairs of variants whose r-squared value is equal to or greater than the value provided.

get.description: Find the species and database for a single identifier e.g. gene, transcript, protein.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl stable ID

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: db_type
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expands the search to include any connected features. e.g. If the object is a gene, its transcripts, translations and exons will be returned as well.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Layout of the response

parameters.name: phenotypes
parameters.description: Include phenotypes. Only available for gene objects.

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: utr
parameters.description: Include 5' and 3' UTR features. Only available if the expand option is used.

parameters.name: species

get.description: Find all the terms descended from a given term. By default searches are conducted within the namespace of the given identifier.

parameters.name: closest_term
parameters.description: If true return only the closest terms to the specified term

parameters.name: ontology
parameters.description: Filter by ontology. Used to disambiguate terms which are shared between ontologies such as GO and EFO

parameters.name: subset
parameters.description: Filter terms by the specified subset

parameters.name: zero_distance
parameters.description: Return terms with a distance of 0

parameters.description: If set the API will avoid the fetching of parent and child terms

get.description: Retrieves features (e.g. genes, transcripts, variants and more) that overlap a region defined by the given identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl stable ID

parameters.name: feature
parameters.description: The type of feature to retrieve. Multiple values are accepted.

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: The functional classification of the gene or transcript to fetch. Cannot be used in conjunction with logic_name when querying transcripts.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: db_type
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: logic_name
parameters.description: Limit retrieval of genes, transcripts and exons by a given name of an analysis.

parameters.name: misc_set
parameters.description: Miscellaneous set which groups together feature entries. Consult the DB or returned data sets to discover what is available.

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter by feature type

parameters.name: so_term
parameters.description: Sequence Ontology term to narrow down the possible variants returned.

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: species_set
parameters.description: Filter by species set for retrieving constrained elements.

parameters.name: variant_set
parameters.description: Short name of a set to restrict the variants found. (See list of short set names)[http://www.ensembl.org/info/genome/variation/data_description.html#variation_sets]

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Response formats

get.description: Retrieves features (e.g. genes, transcripts, variants and more) that overlap a given region.

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Query region. A maximum of 5Mb is allowed to be requested at any one time

parameters.name: feature
parameters.description: The type of feature to retrieve. Multiple values are accepted.

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: The functional classification of the gene or transcript to fetch. Cannot be used in conjunction with logic_name when querying transcripts.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: db_type
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: logic_name
parameters.description: Limit retrieval of genes, transcripts and exons by a given name of an analysis.

parameters.name: misc_set
parameters.description: Miscellaneous set which groups together feature entries. Consult the DB or returned data sets to discover what is available.

parameters.name: so_term
parameters.description: Sequence Ontology term to narrow down the possible variants returned.

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: species_set
parameters.description: Filter by species set for retrieving constrained elements.

parameters.name: variant_set
parameters.description: Short name of a set to restrict the variants found. (See list of short set names)[http://www.ensembl.org/info/genome/variation/data_description.html#variation_sets]

parameters.name: trim_downstream
parameters.description: Do not return features which overlap the downstream end of the region.

parameters.name: trim_upstream
parameters.description: Do not return features which overlap upstream end of the region.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Response formats

get.description: Retrieve features related to a specific Translation as described by its stable ID (e.g. domains, variants).

parameters.name: db_type
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: so_term
parameters.description: Sequence Ontology term to narrow down the possible variants returned.

parameters.name: feature
parameters.description: The type of feature to retrieve. Multiple values are accepted.

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of data to filter by. By default, all features are returned. Can specify a domain or consequence type.

get.description: Request multiple types of sequence by stable identifier. Supports feature masking and expand options.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl stable ID

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: db_type
parameters.description: Restrict the search to a database other than the default. Useful if you need to use a DB other than core

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Trim the end of the sequence by this many basepairs. Trimming is relative to reading direction and in the coordinate system of the stable identifier. Parameter can not be used in conjunction with expand_5prime or expand_3prime.

parameters.name: expand_3prime
parameters.description: Expand the sequence downstream of the sequence by this many basepairs. Only available when using genomic sequence type.

parameters.name: expand_5prime
parameters.description: Expand the sequence upstream of the sequence by this many basepairs. Only available when using genomic sequence type.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Expand the sequence upstream of the sequence by this many basepairs. Only available when using genomic sequence type.

parameters.name: mark
parameters.description: Request the sequence masked for repeat sequences. Hard will mask all repeats as N's and soft will mask repeats as lowercased characters. Only available when using genomic sequence type..

parameters.name: mask_feature
parameters.description: Mask features on the sequence. If sequence is genomic, mask introns. If sequence is cDNA, mask UTRs. Incompatible with the 'mask' option

parameters.name: multiple_sequences
parameters.description: Allow the service to return more than 1 sequence per identifier. This is useful when querying for a gene but using a type such as protein.

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter by feature type

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Trim the start of the sequence by this many basepairs. Trimming is relative to reading direction and in the coordinate system of the stable identifier. Parameter can not be used in conjunction with expand_5prime or expand_3prime.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of sequence. Defaults to genomic where applicable, i.e. not translations. cdna refers to the spliced transcript sequence with UTR; cds refers to the spliced transcript sequence without UTR.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Response formats

post.description: Request multiple types of sequence by a stable identifier list.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: { "ids" : array }

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: db_type

parameters.name: end

parameters.name: expand_3prime
parameters.description: Expand the sequence downstream of the sequence by this many basepairs. Only available when using genomic sequence type.

parameters.name: expand_5prime
parameters.description: Expand the sequence upstream of the sequence by this many basepairs. Only available when using genomic sequence type.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Expand the sequence upstream of the sequence by this many basepairs. Only available when using genomic sequence type.

parameters.name: mark
parameters.description: Request the sequence masked for repeat sequences. Hard will mask all repeats as N's and soft will mask repeats as lowercased characters. Only available when using genomic sequence type..

parameters.name: mask_feature
parameters.description: Mask features on the sequence. If sequence is genomic, mask introns. If sequence is cDNA, mask UTRs. Incompatible with the 'mask' option

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter by feature type

get.description: Fetch variant consequences based on a HGVS notation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Query ID. Supports dbSNP, COSMIC and HGMD identifiers

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: Blosum62
parameters.description: Include BLOSUM62 amino acid conservation score [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/Blosum62.pm)

parameters.name: CSN
parameters.description: Reports Clinical Sequencing Nomenclature (CSN) for variants [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/CSN.pm)

parameters.name: Conservation
parameters.description: Retrieves a conservation score from the Ensembl Compara databases for variant positions [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/Conservation.pm)

parameters.name: GeneSplicer
parameters.description: Detects splice sites in genomic DNA [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/GeneSplicer.pm)

parameters.name: MaxEntScan
parameters.description: Sequence motif and maximum entropy based splice site consensus predictions [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/MaxEntScan.pm)

parameters.name: UpDownDistance
parameters.description: Change the distance to transcript for which VEP assigns upstream and downstream consequences [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/UpDownDistance.pm)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: canonical
parameters.description: Include a flag indicating the canonical transcript for a gene

parameters.name: ccds
parameters.description: Include CCDS transcript identifiers

parameters.name: dbNSFP
parameters.description: Include fields from dbNSFP, a database of pathogenicity predictions for missense variants. Multiple fields should be separated by commas. See dbNSFP README for field list.[plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/dbNSFP.pm)

parameters.name: dbscSNV
parameters.description: Predictions for splicing variants from dbscSNV. [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/dbscSNV.pm)

parameters.name: domains
parameters.description: Include names of overlapping protein domains

parameters.name: hgvs
parameters.description: Include HGVS nomenclature based on Ensembl stable identifiers

parameters.name: merged
parameters.description: Use merged Ensembl and RefSeq transcript set to report consequences (human only)

parameters.name: miRNA
parameters.description: Determines where in the secondary structure of a miRNA a variant falls [plugin details](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ensembl-variation/VEP_plugins/master/miRNA.pm)

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: Include affected exon and intron positions within the transcript

parameters.name: protein
parameters.description: Include Ensembl protein identifiers

parameters.name: refseq
parameters.description: Use RefSeq transcript set to report consequences (human only)

parameters.name: xref_refseq
parameters.description: nclude aligned RefSeq mRNA identifiers for transcript. NB: theRefSeq and Ensembl transcripts aligned in this way MAY NOT, AND FREQUENTLY WILL NOT, match exactly in sequence, exon structure and protein product

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Response formats

parameters.description: nclude aligned RefSeq mRNA identifiers for transcript. NB: theRefSeq and Ensembl transcripts aligned in this way MAY NOT, AND FREQUENTLY WILL NOT, match exactly in sequence, exon structure and protein product

parameters.name: CSN

get.description: Uses a variant identifier (e.g. rsID) to return the variation features including optional genotype, phenotype and population data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An Ensembl stable ID

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name/alias

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Name of the callback subroutine to be returned by the requested JSONP response. Required ONLY when using JSONP as the serialisation method. Please see the [user guide](http://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki).

parameters.name: genotypes
parameters.description: Include individual genotypes

parameters.name: phenotypes
parameters.description: Include phenotypes.

parameters.name: pops
parameters.description: Include population allele frequencies

parameters.name: population
parameters.description: Include population genotype frequencies

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Response formats
